sen.j: 北条 綱成（ほうじょう つなしげ/つななり）（永正12年（1515年）～天正15年（1587年））は、戦国時代 (日本)の武将で、後北条氏家臣。
sen.e: Tsunashige HOJO (1515 - 1587, his given name can be alternatively pronounced as Tsunanari) was a busho (Japanese military commander) in the Sengoku period, and a vassal of Gohojo clan.

Tsunashige HOJO (1515 - 1587, his given name can be alternatively pronounced as Tsunanari) was a busho (Japanese military commander) in the Sengoku period (period of warring states), and a vassal of the Gohojo clan.
sen.cmt: Sengoku periodの補足を追加、the Gohojo clanとしました。
sen.e: Tsunashige HOJO (1515 - 1587, his given name can be alternatively pronounced as Tsunanari) was a busho (Japanese military commander) in the Sengoku period (period of warring states), and a vassal of the Gohojo clan.

sen.j: 父は今川氏家臣の福島正成とされる。
sen.e: It is considered that his father was Masashige KUSHIMA, a vassal of Imagawa clan.
It is considered that his father was Masashige KUSHIMA, a vassal of the Imagawa clan.
It is considered that his father was Masashige KUSHIMA, a vassal of the Imagawa clan.

sen.j: 幼名は勝千代。
sen.e: Tsunashige's childhood name was Katsuchiyo.
Tsunashige's childhood name was Katsuchiyo.
Tsunashige's childhood name was Katsuchiyo.

sen.j: 北条氏に仕えるまで
sen.e: Before the Service to Hojo Clan
Before the Service to the Hojo Clan
Before the Service to the Hojo Clan

sen.j: 大永元年（1521年）、飯田河原の戦いで父・正成ら一族の多くが武田方の原虎胤に討ち取られ、家臣に伴われて小田原に落ち延びて北条氏綱の保護を受け、近習として仕えた。
sen.e: Many of Kushima family including his father Masashige killed by Toratane HARA from Takeda clan in the Battle of Iidagawara in 1521, then Tsunashige escaped to Odawara accompanied by his vassals to be protected by Ujitsuna HOJO, and began to serve him as kinju (attendant).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処「飯田河原」：http://www7a.biglobe.ne.jp/~echigoya/ka/Iidagawara.html
sen.e: Many of the Kushima family including his father Masashige killed by Toratane HARA from the Takeda clan in the Battle of Iidagawara in 1521, then Tsunashige escaped to Odawara accompanied by his vassals to be protected by Ujitsuna HOJO, and began to serve him as kinju (attendant).
sen.cmt: the Kushima family、the Takeda clanとしました。
sen.e: Many of the Kushima family including his father Masashige killed by Toratane HARA from the Takeda clan in the Battle of Iidagawara in 1521, then Tsunashige escaped to Odawara accompanied by his vassals to be protected by Ujitsuna HOJO, and began to serve him as kinju (attendant).

sen.j: また、天文 (元号)5年（1536年）に父が今川家の内紛である花倉の乱で今川義元の異母弟・今川良真（玄広恵探）を支持したために討たれ、氏綱の元へ落ち延びたという説もある。
sen.e: Another explanation is that his father died in Hanakura no Ran (rebellion) which is an internal conflict of Imagawa family due to his supporting a younger paternal brother of Yoshimoto IMAGAWA, Ryoshin IMAGAWA (Eshin GENKO), then Tsunashige escaped to Ujitsuna.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Another explanation is that his father died in the Hanakura War which was an internal conflict of the Imagawa family due to his supporting a younger paternal brother of Yoshimoto IMAGAWA, Ryoshin IMAGAWA (Genko Etan), then Tsunashige escaped to Ujitsuna.
sen.cmt: Hanakura no Ran (rebellion)→統一事項に基づき、the Hanakura Warとし、which is→which was、Eshin GENKO→Genko Etanに修正、the Imagawa familyとしました。
sen.e: There is an another theory that Tsunashige's father was killed because he supported a younger paternal brother of Yoshimoto IMAGAWA, Ryoshin IMAGAWA (Genko Etan), in the Hanakura War which was an internal conflict of the Imagawa family; he then fled to Ujitsuna.
sen.cmt: 原文にあわせて修正しました。

sen.j: 北条氏綱は綱成を大いに気に入り、娘を娶わせて北条一門に迎えるとともに、北条姓を与えたという。
sen.e: Ujitsuna HOJO liked Tsunashige very much, and let Tsunashige marry his daughter to welcome him into Hojo family and give him the name of Hojo.
Ujitsuna HOJO liked Tsunashige very much, and let Tsunashige marry his daughter to welcome him into the Hojo family and give him the name of Hojo.
Ujitsuna HOJO liked Tsunashige very much, and let Tsunashige marry his daughter to welcome him into the Hojo family and give him the name of Hojo.

sen.j: 綱成の名乗りも、氏綱の「綱」と福島正成の「成」を合わせたものである。
sen.e: His Nanori (announcement of one's name) is the combination of 'Tsuna' of Ujitsuna and 'Shige' of Masashige KUSHIMA.
His Nanori (announcement of one's name) is the combination of 'Tsuna' of Ujitsuna and 'Shige' of Masashige KUSHIMA.
His Nanori (announcement of one's name) is the combination of 'Tsuna' of Ujitsuna and 'Shige' of Masashige KUSHIMA.

sen.j: これを見ても、綱成が如何に北条氏綱に評価されていたかが伺えるであろう。
sen.e: This implies Ujitsuna HOJO greatly valued Tsunashige.
This implies Ujitsuna HOJO greatly valued Tsunashige.
This implies Ujitsuna HOJO greatly valued Tsunashige.

sen.j: 氏綱の子である北条為昌の後見役も任され、天文11年（1542年）の為昌没後は第３代玉縄城主となった。
sen.e: He came to be entrusted as a conservator of Tamemasa HOJO, the son of Ujitsuna; after Tamemasa died in 1542, Tsunashige became the third lord of Tamanawa-jo Castle.
He came to be entrusted as a conservator of Tamemasa HOJO, the son of Ujitsuna; after Tamemasa died in 1542, Tsunashige became the third lord of Tamanawa-jo Castle.
He came to be entrusted as a conservator of Tamemasa HOJO, the son of Ujitsuna; after Tamemasa died in 1542, Tsunashige became the third lord of Tamanawa-jo Castle.

sen.j: 「地黄八幡」の闘将
sen.e: Worrier of 'Jio-Hachiman' (God of worriers with yellow flags)
Worrier of 'Jio-Hachiman' (God of worriers with yellow flags)
Worrier of 'Jio-Hachiman' (God of worriers with yellow flags)

sen.j: 天文6年（1537年）から上杉氏との戦いをはじめ、各地を転戦する。
sen.e: From 1537, he began to fight against Uesugi clan and moved from place to place to fight.
From 1537, he began to fight against the Uesugi clan and moved from place to place to fight.
From 1537, he began to fight against the Uesugi clan and moved from place to place to fight.

sen.j: 北条氏の「五備え」では、「黄備え」を担当する。
sen.e: Among 'Go-Sonae' (the five main vassals) of Hojo clan, he was appointed as 'Ki-Sonae' (yellow vassal).
Among 'Go-Sonae' (the five main vassals) of the Hojo clan, he was appointed as 'Ki-Sonae' (yellow vassal).
Among 'Go-Sonae' (the five main vassals) of the Hojo clan, he was appointed as 'Ki-Sonae' (yellow vassal).

sen.j: 天文10年（1541年）、氏綱が死去して北条氏康が家督を継いでも、その信頼が変わることはなかった。
sen.e: After the death of Ujitsuna and the succession of the reigns of the family by Ujiyasu HOJO in 1541, Hojo clan's trust on him remained unchanged.
After the death of Ujitsuna and the succession of the reigns of the family by Ujiyasu HOJO in 1541, the Hojo clan's trust on him remained unchanged.
After the death of Ujitsuna and the succession of the reigns of the family by Ujiyasu HOJO in 1541, the Hojo clan's trust on him remained unchanged.

sen.j: 天文15年（1546年）の河越城の戦いでは、半年余りを籠城戦で耐え抜くという大功を挙げ、北条軍大勝のきっかけを作っている。
sen.e: In the Battle of Kawagoe-jo Castle, he accomplished a meritorious service in which he persisted in the tact of holding the castle for about half a year, which became the cause of Hojo army's triumph.

In the Battle of Kawagoe-jo Castle in 1546, he accomplished a meritorious service in which he persisted in the tact of holding the castle for about half a year, which became the cause of the Hojo army's triumph.
sen.cmt: 「天文15年（1546年）」→訳漏れのため訳出、the Hojo armyとしました。
sen.e: In the Battle of Kawagoe-jo Castle in 1546, he accomplished a meritorious service in which he persisted in the tact of holding the castle for about half a year, which became the cause of the Hojo army's triumph.

sen.j: この功績で河越城主も兼ねることになったとされる。
sen.e: It is considered that he was concurrently appointed as a lord of Kawagoe-jo Castle due to this achievement.
It is considered that he was concurrently appointed as a lord of Kawagoe-jo Castle due to this achievement.
It is considered that he was concurrently appointed as a lord of Kawagoe-jo Castle due to this achievement.

sen.j: その後も里見義堯との国府台合戦、武田信玄との駿河国深沢城の戦いで活躍した。
sen.e: After that, he flourished in Konodai Battle against Yoshitaka SATOMI and the Battle of Fukazawa-jo Castle in Suruga Province against Shingen TAKEDA.
After that, he flourished in the Konodai Battle against Yoshitaka SATOMI and the Battle of Fukazawa-jo Castle in Suruga Province against Shingen TAKEDA.
sen.cmt: in the Konodai Battleとしました。
sen.e: After that, he flourished in the Konodai Battle against Yoshitaka SATOMI and the Battle of Fukazawa-jo Castle in Suruga Province against Shingen TAKEDA.

sen.j: 元亀2年（1571年）10月、氏康が病死すると、綱成も家督を子の北条氏繁に譲って隠居した。
sen.e: When Ujiyasu died from a disease, Tsunashige ceded the reigns of his family to his son Ujishige HOJO to retire.
When Ujiyasu died from a disease in October 1571, Tsunashige ceded the reigns of his family to his son Ujishige HOJO to retire.
sen.cmt: 「元亀2年（1571年）10月」→訳漏れのため訳出しました。
sen.e: When Ujiyasu died from a disease in October 1571, Tsunashige ceded the reigns of his family to his son Ujishige HOJO to retire.

sen.j: 剃髪して上総入道道感と名乗った。
sen.e: He was tonsured and referred to himself as Kazusa-nyudo Dokan
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He was tonsured and referred to himself as Kazusa-nyudo Dokan.
sen.cmt: ピリオド追加しました。
sen.e: He was tonsured and referred to himself as Kazusa-nyudo Dokan.

sen.j: 天正15年（1587年）5月6日、病のために死去、享年73。
sen.e: In May 6, 1587, he died from a disease at the age of 73.
On June 11, 1587, he died from a disease at the age of 73.
sen.cmt: In→On、旧暦→新暦に修正しました。
sen.e: On June 11, 1587, he died from a disease at the age of 73.

tit.cmt: 人物→統一リストの表記に修正しました。

sen.j: 綱成は若い頃から武勇に秀で、毎月15日は必ず身を清めて八幡大菩薩に戦勝を祈願したといわれている。
sen.e: From his early years, Tsunashige was excellent at military prowess; he necessarily purified his body to pray for a victory to Hachiman Daibosatsu (great bodhisattva) on 15th of every month.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: From his early years, Tsunashige was excellent at military prowess; he never failed to purify his body to pray for a victory to Hachiman Daibosatsu (great bodhisattva) on 15th of every month.
sen.cmt: he necessarily purified→he never failed to purifyとしました。
sen.e: From his early years, Tsunashige was excellent at military prowess; he never failed to purify his body to pray for a victory to Hachiman Daibosatsu (great bodhisattva) on 15th of every month.

sen.j: そして合戦になると朽葉色に染めた旗を指物として、常に北条軍の先鋒としてその無類の強さを見せつけた。
sen.e: In the battle, he always showed his incomparable strength in the van of Hojo army with battle flags colored in pale brown.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In the battle, he always showed his incomparable strength in the van of the Hojo army with battle flags colored in pale brown.
In the battle, he always showed his incomparable strength in the van of the Hojo army with battle flags colored in pale brown.

sen.j: その旗色から「地黄八幡」と称えられた。
sen.e: Thanks to the color of the flags, he was honored as 'Jio-Hachiman' (God of worriers with yellow flags).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: From the color of the flags, he was honored as 'Jio-Hachiman' (God of worriers with yellow flags).
From the color of the flags, he was honored as 'Jio-Hachiman' (God of worriers with yellow flags).

sen.j: 近隣には常勝軍団としてその名がとどろいたといわれる。
sen.e: His name was known as an invincible army to his neighbors.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: His name was known as an invincible army to his neighbors.
His name was known as an invincible army to his neighbors.

sen.j: 少年期には評判の芳しくなかった北条氏康の代わりとして、北条家当主に擬する動きまであったという。
sen.e: There was even a move that he was mentioned as a head of Hojo family instead of Ujiyasu HOJO who had poor reputations in his boyhood.
There was even a move that he was mentioned as a head of the Hojo family instead of Ujiyasu HOJO who had poor reputations in his boyhood.
There was even a move that he was mentioned as a head of the Hojo family instead of Ujiyasu HOJO who had poor reputations in his boyhood.

sen.j: 北条綱成の「地黄八幡」の旗指物は現在、長野県長野市松代町 (長野県)の真田宝物館に現存する。
sen.e: The 'Jio-Hachiman' battle flags of Tsunashige HOJO is currently existing in Sanada Clan Museum in Matsushiro-cho, Nagano City, Nagano Prefecture.
The 'Jio-Hachiman' battle flags of Tsunashige HOJO is currently existing in Sanada Clan Museum in Matsushiro-cho, Nagano City, Nagano Prefecture.
The 'Jio-Hachiman' battle flags of Tsunashige HOJO is currently existing in Sanada Clan Museum in Matsushiro-cho, Nagano City, Nagano Prefecture.

sen.j: これは、武田氏と後北条氏が対立していた元亀2年（1571年）、綱成が守備していた駿河深沢城を、武田信玄に対し開城して小田原に去った際、城内に放置されていた物である。
sen.e: This item was left in Suruga Fukazawa-jo Castle he defended, when he surrendered the castle to Shingen TAKEDA and went off to Odawara in 1571; at that time, Takeda clan and Gohojo clan conflicted each other.

This item was left in Suruga Fukazawa-jo Castle he defended, when he surrendered the castle to Shingen TAKEDA and went off to Odawara in 1571; at that time, the Takeda clan and the Gohojo clan conflicted each other.
sen.cmt: the Takeda clan、the Gohojo clanとしました。
sen.e: This item was left in Suruga Fukazawa-jo Castle he defended, when he surrendered the castle to Shingen TAKEDA and went off to Odawara in 1571; at that time, the Takeda clan and the Gohojo clan conflicted each other.

sen.j: 信玄は「左衛門大夫（北条綱成）の武勇にあやかるように」と、家臣真田幸隆の息子・源次郎（真田昌輝）に与えたとされる。
sen.e: It is considered that Shingen provided the flag to the son of his vassal Yukitaka SANADA, Genjiro (Masateru SANADA), wishing Genjiro to 'follow the military prowess of Saemon no taifu (Tsunashige HOJO)'.

It is considered that Shingen provided the flag to the son of his vassal Yukitaka SANADA, Genjiro (Masateru SANADA), wishing Genjiro to 'follow the military prowess of Saemon no taifu (Tsunashige HOJO).'
sen.cmt: ピリオドの位置を移動しました。
sen.e: It is considered that Shingen provided the flag to the son of his vassal Yukitaka SANADA, Genjiro (Masateru SANADA), wishing Genjiro to 'follow the military prowess of Saemon no taifu (Tsunashige HOJO).'

sen.j: 氏康からの信任は厚く、氏康の名代として外交や軍事の全権を与えられることもあったとされる。
sen.e: Tsunashige had a strong trust from Ujiyasu; it is said he was given the plenary power of diplomacy and military as a representative of Ujiyasu.
Tsunashige had a strong trust from Ujiyasu; it is said he was given the plenary power of diplomacy and military as a representative of Ujiyasu.
Tsunashige had a strong trust from Ujiyasu; it is said he was given the plenary power of diplomacy and military as a representative of Ujiyasu.

sen.j: 戦場では常に勇敢だった。
sen.e: Tsunashige was always brave in the battlefields.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Tsunashige was always brave in the battlefields.
Tsunashige was always brave in the battlefields.

sen.j: 特に野戦では大将であるにも関わらずに常に先頭に立って「勝った!」と叫びながら突撃したとされる。
sen.e: Especially in the open battle, he was always at the forefront in spite of his being taisho (general) and made a sortie, crying 'Katta!' (I won).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Especially in the open battle, he was always at the forefront in spite of his being taisho (general) and made a sortie, crying 'Katta!' (I won).
Especially in the open battle, he was always at the forefront in spite of his being taisho (general) and made a sortie, crying 'Katta!' (I won).

sen.j: その武勇には武田軍も恐れた。
sen.e: Even Takeda army was afraid of his military braveness.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Even the Takeda army was afraid of his military braveness.
Even the Takeda army was afraid of his military braveness.

sen.j: 深沢城の戦いでは圧倒的な兵力差であるにも関わらず、武田軍は綱成に苦戦したとされる。
sen.e: In the Battle of Fukazawa-jo Castle, Takeda army had a hard battle against Tsunashige regardless of overwhelming difference of the military power.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In the Battle of Fukazawa-jo Castle, the Takeda army had a hard battle against Tsunashige in spite of overwhelming difference of the military power.
sen.cmt: the Takeda armyとし、regardless of→in spite ofに修正しました。
sen.e: In the Battle of Fukazawa-jo Castle, the Takeda army had a hard battle against Tsunashige in spite of overwhelming difference of the military power.
